dtliExcerpt: “The Queen of Versailles” is designed to bring out all of Chenoweth’s Broadway shine. She never looks less than perfectly photoshopped, but the production ultimately overtaxes her strengths. New musicals are impossible dreams, and this is a whopper of a show, daunting in scale and jaw-dropping in ambition. If only Chenoweth’s dazzling star power didn’t have to do so much of the heavy lifting.

keyPhrases.quote: No one could possibly be working harder right now on Broadway than Kristin Chenoweth, who is bearing the weight of a McMansion musical on her diminutive frame
it's still an unwieldy operation despite the impeccable showmanship of Michael Arden's direction
If only Chenoweth's dazzling star power didn't have to do so much of the heavy lifting

llmScore.reasoning: The critic praises Chenoweth's performance and acknowledges the production's ambition, but repeatedly emphasizes that the musical is structurally flawed and overly dependent on its star, suggesting a qualified recommendation at best.

bwwExcerpt: No one could possibly be working harder right now on Broadway than Kristin Chenoweth, who is bearing the weight of a McMansion musical on her diminutive frame and making it seem like she’s hoisting nothing heavier than a few overstuffed Hermes, Prada and Chanel shopping bags.
